snippet: In an effort to show its benefit to the American job market, Apple on Friday published the results of a study it commissioned saying that it had “created or supported” 514,000 American jobs.
abstract: Apple, attempting to show its benefit to the American job market, publishes results of a study it commissioned saying that it has 'created or supported' 514,000 American jobs; says firm's value to the United States job market goes far beyond the 47,000 people it directly employs in nation; accuracy of the Apple jobs calculation may well be debated among economists for years.
lead_paragraph: In an effort to show its benefit to the American job market, Apple on Friday published the results of a study it commissioned saying that it had “created or supported” 514,000 American jobs.

headline.seo: Apple Study on Job Creation Spurs an Economic Debate
headline.main: Apple’s Job Creation Data Spurs an Economic Debate
headline.print_headline: Apple’s Job Creation Data Spurs an Economic Debate
